gurmukhi: ਲਗੇ ਠਾਮ ਠਾਮੰ ਦਮਾਮੰ ਦਮੰਕੇ ॥ ਖੁਲੇ ਖੇਤ ਮੋ ਖੱਗ ਖੂਨੀ ਖਿਮੰਕੇ ॥
transliteration: Lage Thaam Thaanan Damaan Damannde|| Khule Khet Mo Khagg Khoomikhimanke||
translation: All resisted at their place and the trumpets began to resound violently, he bloody daggers coming out (from) the scabbards) glistened in the battlefield.

gurmukhi: ਭੲੇ ਕ੍ਰੂਰ ਭਾਂਤੰ ਕਮਾਣੰ ਕੜੱਕੇ ॥ ਨਚੇ ਬੀਰ ਬੈਤਾਲ ਭੂਤੰ ਭੜੱਕੇ ॥੪੯॥
transliteration: Bhae Kroor Bhaantan Kamaanan Kadaakke|| Nache Beer Baitaal Bhootan Bhadakke||49||
translation: The voice of the cracking of the cruel bows were heard and the ghosts and goblins began to dance furiously.49.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰਯੋ ਅਾਯੁਧੰ ਸਾਯੁਧੰ ਬੀਰ ਖੇਤੰ ॥ ਨਚੇ ਕੰਧ ਹੀਣੰ ਕਮੱਧੰ ਅਚੇਤੰ ॥
transliteration: Giryo Aayudhan Saayudhan Beer Khetan|| Nache Kandh Heenan Kamaddhan Achetan||
translation: The warriors began to fall in the battlefield alongwith their weapons, and the headless trunks began to dance unconsciously in the war.

gurmukhi: ਖੁਲੇ ਖੱਗ ਖੂਨੀ ਖਿਯਾਲੰ ਖਤੰਗੰ ॥ ਭਜੇ ਕਾਤਰੰ ਸੂਰ ਬੱਜੇ ਨਿਹੰਗੰ ॥੫੦॥
transliteration: Khule Khagg Khoonikhiyaalan Khatanadg|| Bhaje Kaaran Soor Bajje Nihanadg||50||
translation: The bloody daggers and sharp arrow were struck, the trumpets began to resound violently and the warriors began to run hither and thither.50.

gurmukhi: ਕਟੇ ਚਰਮ ਬਰਮੰ ਗਿਰਿਯੋ ਸਤ੍ਰ ਸਸਤ੍ਰੰ ॥ ਭਕੇ ਭੈ ਭਰੇ ਭੂਤ ਭੂਮੰ ਨ੍ਰਿਸਤ੍ਰੰ ॥
transliteration: Kate Charam Baramannd Giriyo Satra Sastran|| Bhake Bhai Bhare Bhoot Bhooman Nristran||

gurmukhi: ਰਣੰ ਰੰਗ ਰਤੇ ਸਭੀ ਰੰਗ ਭੂਮੰ ॥ ਗਿਰੇ ਜੁਧ ਮੱਧੰ ਬਲੀ ਝੂਮ ਝੂਮੰ ॥੫੧॥
transliteration: Ranan Ran Rate Sabhiran Bhooman|| Gire Judh Maddhan Balijhoom Jhooman||51||
translation: All were dyed in the dye of war and the mighty warriors began to fall in the battlefield swinging and reeling.51

gurmukhi: ਭਯੋ ਦੁੰਦ ਜੁੱਧੰ ਰਣੰ ਸੰਖ ਮੱਛੰ ॥ ਮਨੋ ਦੋ ਗਿਰੰ ਜੁੱਧ ਜੁੱਟੇ ਸਪੱਛੰ ॥
transliteration: Bhayo Dound Juddhan Ranan Machchhan|| Mano Do Giran Juddh Joutte Sapachchhan||
translation: Such a horrible battle was fought between Shankhasura and Machh. It appeared clearly that two mountains were waging war with each other.

gurmukhi: ਕਟੇ ਮਾਸ ਟੁੱਕੰ ਭਖੇ ਗਿੱਧਿ ਬ੍ਰਿਧੰ ॥ ਹਸੀ ਜੋਗਣੀ ਚੳੁਸਠਾ ਸੂਰ ਸੁੱਧੰ ॥੫੨॥
transliteration: Kate Maas Toukkan Bhakhe Giddh(i) Bridhan Hasijogadichaousathaa Soor Suddhan||52||
translation: The bits of flesh began to fall, which were devoured by huge vultures, and the sixty-four vampires (Yoginis) began to laugh on seeing this terrible war.52.

gurmukhi: ਕੀਯੋ ੳੁਧਾਰ ਬੇਦੰ ਹਤੇ ਸੰਖ ਬੀਰੰ ॥ ਤਜਯੋ ਮੱਛ ਰੂਪੰ ਸਜਯੋ ਸੁੰਦ੍ਰ ਚੀਰੰ ॥
transliteration: Keeyo Udhaar Bedan Hate Sankh Bderan|| Tajyo Machchh Roopan Sajyo Soundra Chderan||
translation: After killing Shankhasura, the Machh (fish) incarnation redeemed the Vedas and Lord, forsaking the Fish-form, bedecked himself with winsome garments.
